text: Carmen Wiedenmann (born 25 November 1967) is a Slovenian former professional tennis player. During her career she represented Yugoslavia and was known by her birth name Karmen Škulj. ==Biography== Škulj comes from a family with a history in tennis. Two uncles Aleksander and Borut both played competitively and her aunty Irena competed for Yugoslavia in the Federation Cup. The Škulj Tenis Center in Dobrova was established by the family. From 1986 to 1988, Škulj appeared in a total of eight ties for the Yugoslavia Federation Cup team. She also represented Yugoslavia at the 1989 Hopman Cup, where she teamed up with Slobodan Živojinović. Škulj has a niece, Maja Živec-Škulj, who played on the WTA Tour in the 1990s. Her son Luca featured on the ITF junior circuit and plays collegiate tennis for the University of Tennessee. She is now known as Carmen Wiedenmann and works as a tennis trainer in Augsburg, Germany. ==ITF Circuit finals== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%;" width=15% |- bgcolor="lightblue" | $25,000 tournaments |- bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | $10,000 tournaments |} ===Singles (1–0)=== {|class="sortable wikitable" style=font- size:97% !Outcome !No. !Date !Tournament !Surface !Opponent !Score |- style="background:#f0f8ff;" | bgcolor="98FB98"|Winner | 1. | 1 June 1987 | Adria, Italy | Clay | Olga Tsarbopoulou | 3–6, 6–3, 6–3 |} ===Doubles (1–1)=== {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#efefef" |Outcome | No. | Date | Tournament | Surface | Partner | Opponents | Score |- style="background:#f0f8ff;" | bgcolor="98FB98"|Winner | 1. | 24 September 1984 | Bol, Yugoslavia | Clay | Miluše Dosedělová | Martina Reinhardt Joy Tacon | 6–3, 6–4 |- style="background:lightblue;" | bgcolor="FFA07A"|Runner-up | 2. | 8 September 1986 | Zagreb, Yugoslavia | Clay | Renata Šašak | Natalia Egorova Viktoria Milvidskaia | 2–6, 3–6 |} ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Yugoslav female tennis players Category:Slovenian female tennis players Category:Slovenian emigrants to Germany Category:Hopman Cup competitors
title: Karmen Škulj
